intro: Acer shensiense, commonly known as the Sichuan maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has smooth, greyish-brown bark. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in early spring before the leaves emerge. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well adapted to temperate climates.
